page.title: 03NORTH DURHAM VILLAGE (CONT)
page.content: Due to the closure of the old Coal Mines, there is much derelict land around some of which has been reclaimed for a small industrial estate at Stella Gill. Very few new industries have come to the area to replace the old and most people travel out of the area to work. There are two disused mineral lines in this area, one has been pulled up, the other, which goes to Consett has only recently become disused. As industry has changed, so have the local shops. The Post Office is still here, but the Grocer, the Ironmonger and a Fish and Chip shop have all been knocked down. Many people felt that their area was becoming run down and in need of improvement. Most people thought that this area has nothing to offer the tourist apart from the Church which is 143 years old.
